result.execSummary:
The defendant William R Pownell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

All financials same as noted above.
Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William R Pownell in court.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he does not qualify for public defender.  Defendant wants to waive his right to counsel today.  Court advises party of his right, asks questions, and allows defendant to waive counsel.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Remarks by Atty. Parker and the defendant.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.  Appeal rights given.

Sentence:  $250.00 fine + costs; plus DNA SC and sample.

Defendant William R Pownell in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  DA requests absolute sobriety to bond conditions.  So ordered.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
